question: 1 (d)
statement_html:
Suppose you are given a set of N data points (xn, yn), with xn increasing, and you wish to interpolate these points with a spline function \(f\), where \(f\)(x) is given by the cubic polynomial pn(x) on each interval (xn, xn+1) for n = 1, ..., N-1:

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle p_n(x) = a_n(x-x_n)^3 + b_n(x-x_n)^2 + c_n(x-x_n) + d_n\end{aligned}\]

(d) Write down the matrix equation to be solved for the coefficients of the polynomials in the case N = 3, with x1 = 1, x2 = 2, x3 = 3.
statement_latex:
Suppose you are given a set of \emph{N} data points
\emph{(x\textsubscript{n}, y\textsubscript{n})}, with
\emph{x\textsubscript{n}} increasing, and you wish to interpolate these
points with a spline function \emph{$f$}, where \emph{$f$(x)} is given by
the cubic polynomial \emph{p\textsubscript{n}(x)} on each interval
\emph{(x\textsubscript{n}, x\textsubscript{n+1})} for \emph{n = 1, ...,
N-1}:

\begin{align*}
\displaystyle
p_n(x) = a_n(x-x_n)^3 + b_n(x-x_n)^2 + c_n(x-x_n) + d_n
\end{align*}

\textbf{(d)} Write down the matrix equation to be solved for the
coefficients of the polynomials in the case \emph{N = 3}, with
\emph{x\textsubscript{1} = 1}, \emph{x\textsubscript{2} = 2},
\emph{x\textsubscript{3} = 3}.
statement_raw:
Suppose you are given a set of ''N'' data points ''(x<sub>n</sub>, y<sub>n</sub>)'', with ''x<sub>n</sub>'' increasing, and you wish to interpolate these points with a spline function ''&fnof;'', where ''&fnof;(x)'' is given by the cubic polynomial ''p<sub>n</sub>(x)'' on each interval ''(x<sub>n</sub>, x<sub>n+1</sub>)'' for ''n = 1, ..., N-1'':

:<math> \displaystyle
p_n(x) = a_n(x-x_n)^3 + b_n(x-x_n)^2 + c_n(x-x_n) + d_n
</math>

'''(d)''' Write down the matrix equation to be solved for the coefficients of the polynomials in the case ''N = 3'', with ''x<sub>1</sub> = 1'', ''x<sub>2</sub> = 2'', ''x<sub>3</sub> = 3''.
